item.title: Farmers Fight Environmental Regulations
item.description: March 7, 2017 - Many of America's farmers are successfully fending off environmental regulation, from the Obama administration's Clean Water Rule to a lawsuit in Iowa that's aimed at reducing nitrates in rivers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - Many of America's farmers are successfully fending off environmental regulation, from the Obama administration's Clean Water Rule to a lawsuit in Iowa that's aimed at reducing nitrates in rivers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/07/518841084/farmers-fight-environmental-regulations

item.title: Tribes & Traitors: What Happens When You Empathize with the Enemy?
item.description: March 6, 2017 - This week on Hidden Brain, the stories of two men who showed empathy for the other side and found themselves labeled "enemy" by their own people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - This week on Hidden Brain, the stories of two men who showed empathy for the other side and found themselves labeled "enemy" by their own people. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518786831/tribes-traitors-what-happens-when-you-empathize-with-the-enemy

item.title: Dakota Access Demonstrators Inspire New Pipeline Protests
item.description: March 6, 2017 - Opponents lost their bid to stop the Dakota Access pipeline, but their effort has energized others. Pipeline protests are expanding across the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Opponents lost their bid to stop the Dakota Access pipeline, but their effort has energized others. Pipeline protests are expanding across the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518858259/dakota-access-demonstrators-inspire-new-pipeline-protests

item.title: Reports Of Medical Breakthroughs Often Don't Prove Out
item.description: March 6, 2017 - Medical breakthroughs that were covered by newspapers were often later disproved by more comprehensive research, a study finds. That's a problem for scientists and journalists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Medical breakthroughs that were covered by newspapers were often later disproved by more comprehensive research, a study finds. That's a problem for scientists and journalists. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518802242/reports-of-medical-breakthroughs-often-dont-prove-out

item.title: WATCH: Tracking Lightning Strikes, From Space
item.description: March 6, 2017 - NOAA's new weather satellite is carrying the first lightning detector ever parked in orbit over Earth. It has sent back its first images of real-time lightning storms in the Western Hemisphere.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - NOAA's new weather satellite is carrying the first lightning detector ever parked in orbit over Earth. It has sent back its first images of real-time lightning storms in the Western Hemisphere. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/06/518776626/watch-tracking-lightning-strikes-from-space

item.title: Feeling Lonely? Too Much Time On Social Media May Be Why
item.description: March 6, 2017 - It's not clear whether spending a lot of time on Facebook, Snapchat or Instagram leads to social isolation, or whether the lonely seek solace in social media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - It's not clear whether spending a lot of time on Facebook, Snapchat or Instagram leads to social isolation, or whether the lonely seek solace in social media. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518362255/feeling-lonely-too-much-time-on-social-media-may-be-why

item.title: Did You Get Bit By A Lyme-Infested Tick? Here's What To Do
item.description: March 6, 2017 - One scientist is predicting a risky year for tick-borne Lyme disease in the Northeast, and it's spreading. But don't panic. We've got tips.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - One scientist is predicting a risky year for tick-borne Lyme disease in the Northeast, and it's spreading. But don't panic. We've got tips. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518065660/if-you-get-bit-by-a-lyme-infested-tick-here-are-5-tips

item.title: Forbidding Forecast For Lyme Disease In The Northeast
item.description: March 6, 2017 - Lyme disease is spreading, and this summer is shaping up as a whopper. Why has the tick-borne illness gotten so bad? The answer traces back to something the colonists did more than 200 years ago.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Lyme disease is spreading, and this summer is shaping up as a whopper. Why has the tick-borne illness gotten so bad? The answer traces back to something the colonists did more than 200 years ago. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/06/518219485/forbidding-forecast-for-lyme-disease-in-the-northeast

item.title: Thomas Starzl, Trailblazer In Organ Transplantation, Dies At 90
item.description: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/05/518644481/thomas-starzl-trailblazer-in-organ-transplantation-dies-at-90

item.title: For The First Time In 146 Years Chicago Goes Without Snow During January And February
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Tom Skilling, chief meteorologist for WGN-TV and The Chicago Tribune, talks about the Windy City's changing weather, specifically the record-breaking lack of snow this year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Tom Skilling, chief meteorologist for WGN-TV and The Chicago Tribune, talks about the Windy City's changing weather, specifically the record-breaking lack of snow this year. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/04/518527669/for-the-first-time-in-146-years-chicago-goes-without-snow-during-january-and-feb

item.title: Doctor Launches Vision Quest To Help Astronauts' Eyeballs
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/04/518214299/doctor-launches-vision-quest-to-help-astronauts-eyeballs

item.title: A Dip In Global Prices Creates Cocoa Crisis For Ivory Coast's Farmers
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Ivory coast is the world's largest cocoa producer. But a bumper crop combined with a fall in the global demand for chocolate and a dip in cocoa prices are hurting the country's cocoa farmers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Ivory coast is the world's largest cocoa producer. But a bumper crop combined with a fall in the global demand for chocolate and a dip in cocoa prices are hurting the country's cocoa farmers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/518328252/a-dip-in-global-prices-creates-cocoa-crisis-for-ivory-coasts-farmers

item.title: Rick Perry Looks To Bring Texas Approach To Energy Department
item.description: March 3, 2017 - On Thursday, former Texas Gov. Rick Perry was sworn in as the energy secretary for the Trump administration. NPR looks ahead to a series of upcoming pieces examining Perry's role in expanding wind energy production in Texas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - On Thursday, former Texas Gov. Rick Perry was sworn in as the energy secretary for the Trump administration. NPR looks ahead to a series of upcoming pieces examining Perry's role in expanding wind energy production in Texas. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/03/518391625/rick-perry-looks-to-bring-texas-approach-to-energy-department

item.title: The Culprit In Rising Western U.S. Smog Levels: Asia
item.description: March 3, 2017 - U.S. emissions of smog-forming pollutants have dropped, but smog levels in the western U.S. have increased each year. Now, researchers say, they've found out why — it's wafting from across the Pacific Ocean.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - U.S. emissions of smog-forming pollutants have dropped, but smog levels in the western U.S. have increased each year. Now, researchers say, they've found out why — it's wafting from across the Pacific Ocean. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/03/518391618/the-culprit-in-rising-western-u-s-smog-levels-asia

item.title: Do Showers Make Oranges Taste Better? NPR Investigates
item.description: March 3, 2017 - The Internet is full of things, including a Reddit subgroup devoted to the act of eating an orange in the shower. We gave it a shot ourselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - The Internet is full of things, including a Reddit subgroup devoted to the act of eating an orange in the shower. We gave it a shot ourselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/518323093/do-showers-make-oranges-taste-better-npr-investigates
